title: Great place to work
pros: Free lunch, wellness activities including trivia, massages, yoga, diversity and inclusion opportunities and volunteer work.
cons: Cross departmental communication can use some work

title: Lack of Leadership and Overworked Employees
pros: Pros: Some genuinely talented and hardworking team members Opportunities to gain experience in a fast-paced environment Exposure to interesting projects within the real estate space Free lunches
cons: Cons: Serious lack of strong, consistent leadership Poor communication from upper management Employees are regularly overworked and under-supported Little to no recognition for extra effort or long hours Burnout is common and often goes unaddressed

title: Review
pros: Good working environment that provides wfh on Fridays
cons: Top down culture with senior management

title: Details
pros: Manage day to day as needed
cons: Certain senior managers run the show and make decisions that may not be the best holistic approach

title: Good to place to get your feet wet.
pros: multi-hat role exposes you to various aspects of IT.
cons: less room for growth in technlogy

title: Great place to work!
pros: Free lunch daily, monthly massages, yoga and boot camp classes, DEI and ESG focused. Friendly environment. WFH Fridays
cons: 4 days in the office but management is flexible

title: Rumor mill & Clicky. It' s who you know
pros: Parking, benefits, wellness, commute, option to work remotely
cons: Too many favoritism and unwarranted promotions just off of who you're friends with.

title: Good pay bad leadership
pros: Company has good pay that’s about it
cons: management is horrible. Little to no support

title: Great pay
pros: Pay was great plus bonus.
cons: Management is horrible. No support.

title: Horrible Senior Management
pros: Friendly staff/great office environment/wellness perks
cons: No work/life balance Horrible senior management

title: Dysfunction at the highest levels
pros: Contemporary office space- investment in technology
cons: Senior Management is very dysfunctional. There is a tremendous amount of back biting among the Senior leadership team that trickles down to the general population. It is almost encouraged by the CEO and CAO. While they give a half hearted attempt at a collegial and collaborative environment it couldn't be any more divisive. Morale is low and the office environment has a very heavy negative energy. Absolutely no room for growth. It's as if the CEO is intimidated by furthering the careers of very talented professionals. HR support is weak and/or non is existent.

title: I truly enjoy working for this company!
pros: This was my third full-time job out of college in 16 months and I have currently been with the company for 2 years now. I not only enjoy the work but I work with some of the best people I know! The company takes care of their employees which is why we have a low turnover rate.
cons: I cannot think of anything I would want them to change. Everyone has their days when they don't want to go to work but in the last two years, I have really only had about 3 of those days total!

title: Solid Company, Organizational Changes Required
pros: Experienced C-Level Team, Broad Mandate within Retail
cons: C-Level oversight and decision making on certain issues required

title: Awesome place to work!
pros: Great chemistry. Everyone gets along well. Very casual environment. Flexible work schedules. Everyone has the ability to work remotely if they need to and are given new laptop tablet PCs to do so. Plenty of cool programs like Wellness, Yoga and after work boot camp with professional trainers. Every month they celebrate that month's birthdays with cake and there are yearly ping pong tournaments. Young employees who excel in their roles are quickly noticed and often promoted. Company seems very stable. Senior managers have been around a long time with some retiring soon.
cons: none at the present time.

title: This Company "Just Gets It!"
pros: Strong belief in Human Capital Fantastic Culture 21st Century Work Space Transparent & Authentic Leaders Believer in work/life balance Passion for developing talent Values: Integrity/Intelligence/Intelligence/Innovation
cons: "Some" senior leaders old school

title: They try hard to do it right!
pros: Very progressive from a Human Capital perspective for a company of this size. Decent amount of autonomy. New ideas are embraced, but only in certain disciplines.
cons: Department heads don't collaborate as well as they should. Clearly there are information silos. Much more focus needed on collaborative technology. Salaries often below industry norms.

title: Horrible Place
pros: The location of their office
cons: So many cons that it’s hard to know where to start. The current HR team couldn’t care less about their employees to even smile when they pass you in the hallway. The morale is low throughout the entire office and it feels very negative. The CEO only truly cares about the employees in the acquisitions department and leasing and the rest mean nothing. Overall the company pretends its innovative and collaborative but it’s not. There is not real room for growth here besides getting more work dumped on you and being told title doesn’t mean anything here.

title: Not a Loyal Company to Employees
pros: You get to work at a public and private reit (hybrid) with retail specialty
cons: -The company has no problem firing people; this can create a hostile work environment -Minimal, if any, training for new employees -People do not go to lunch together regularly -Not many young employees -The intern program is talked up so much that it feels like interns are generally treated better than full-time employees (except that almost none of them get rehired full time)

title: Not good for young employees
pros: You get solid PTO but...cons>pros
cons: Small company feeling with heavy division between groups, people often leave early or get replaced quickly, antisocial environment where noboddy eats lunch toether except one guy who is creepy and asks everyone "so guys, what is for lunch today" starting at 9:30am, churn em and burn em mentaility for younger employees, long hours in development and acquisitions, I choose to leave bc of slow growth ops, also the IT department is unhelpful

title: Great culture, great people
pros: A well-managed real estate investment and management company. Seasoned and tenured executive team, a respectful work environment. Opportunities to advance for those who demonstrate success.
cons: Two office location (Rye / NYC) the team is sometimes not all under one roof. 4-days a week in the office might not be ideal for everyone.

title: Clueless, Aging Executives.
pros: Multi-faceted roles. Lot of hands on work.
cons: Dinosaur executive team who incessantly refute change. Compensation is too low for the current market environment.

title: Great Benefits, Org chart needs a lot of cleaning up
pros: Great Benefits. Great learning experience for new grads / interns.
cons: Very uptight and formal setting. Lots of unhealthy competition. Too many people reporting to an SVP. Needs a lot of organizational structuring. Unnecessarily long work hours

title: Discriminated for being Jamaican and called a coconut by management 2 times
pros: Good Benefits and work and life balance
cons: Management lies and does what they want without any disciplinary actions taken no matter how many times you go to HR

title: It's not easy to work at this company. A lot of hours and stress but I learned a lot.
pros: Very fast paced and you will learn a lot.
cons: Lack of communication as to the progress of your work, no training and Male oriented.

title: Ok if you know what you are doing
pros: People were nice and supportive, had quite a few close friends, work was interesting
cons: Better know what you are doing, probably not the best if you need guidance or just get started in your career

title: Summer Intern
pros: Great office culture with personal interaction with all senior vice presidents and executives. Overall a great experience.
cons: Work load was lacking at sometimes during the internship, but overall projects were very involved and mimicked those associates were working on at the time.

title: Excellent Company, Positive & Productive work environment
pros: Excellent Human Capital team. Great work/life balance. This is a company that strongly focus's on the well- being of its employees which leads to a positive and productive work environment.
cons: I can not think of any.

title: Pro and Con
pros: Wellness is valued at the company
cons: Does not do a good job with employee reviews throughout the year

title: Good company
pros: Good company and great benefits.
cons: Remote option would be helpful. They do allow work from home on need basis.

title: Great company
pros: Great team and fun place to work.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about the company.

pros: good time management and better standard of living
cons: no profits or benefits from company

title: Lease Admin
pros: Great training and company atmosphere
cons: Rye office location is far from ammenities

title: Full time
pros: Great and very smart people
cons: NA - a pleasure working here.

title: Small company
pros: Acadia has a strong balance sheet
cons: Divisive insular core management team
